CreditLine: Acquired by Henry Walters with the Massarenti Collection, 1902
Description: This round platter and its pair, Walters 48.1759, are painted in blue, green, yellow, ochre, tan, reddish-brown, black, grey, light purple, and vivid pinkish-mauve and are heightened with gold. The background depicts a landscape and the rim is dark blue. On the platter are a group of peasants resting outside a city wall, one on horseback. In the center, a gypsy is telling a young man's fortune, and looking down from a portico at the left are two ladies. Both platters are marked in the lower right: C & C (or C & G). The backs are white.
Inscriptions: [Transcription] On the front, below the seated figure in the lower right, faintly visible: C & C (or C & G?)
Medium: earthenware with tin glaze (maiolica) and gold luster
Provenance: Don Marcello Massarenti Collection, Rome [no. 411]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1902, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.

RelatedObjects.RelationType: See Also, One of a Pair

Title: One of a Pair of Platters with a Pastoral Scene
